prompt: Generate realistic text messages that represent non-spam (ham) content. These messages should reflect a broad spectrum of everyday communication, including personal conversations, legitimate business or service notifications, casual updates, and automated alerts. Vary the tone (friendly, professional, neutral, concerned), language style (informal chats, formal announcements, concise or detailed), and topics (meeting or appointment reminders, family or friend check-ins, order or delivery confirmations, bank transaction alerts, community or event updates). Include diverse formats like quick one-word replies, detailed explanations, friendly greetings, or automated system messages (e.g., OTP codes, subscription reminders). Ensure the content simulates authentic, non-malicious communication across different contexts, relationships, and platforms, avoiding any deceptive or promotional undertones.
response:
Hey! Just wanted to check in and see how your day is going.  
Don’t forget our meeting tomorrow at 10 AM. Let me know if you need anything beforehand.  
Your grocery order has been successfully placed! It'll arrive between 3 PM and 5 PM.  
Could you please send me the report by end of day? Thanks!  
Just a reminder that your subscription renews next week.  
Hey, are we still on for dinner tonight?  
Your package has been delivered! Check your porch.  
Looking forward to seeing you at the family reunion next month!  
Can you pick up the kids from school today?  
Your bank statement is ready to view online.  
Congrats on your promotion! Let’s celebrate soon!  
Just wanted to say I’m thinking of you. Hope all is well!  
The event has been rescheduled to Saturday at 2 PM.  
Please confirm your attendance for the workshop by Friday.  
I received your message; let’s discuss it during our call later.  
Your OTP for the transaction is 123456.  
Nice seeing you at the conference! Let’s keep in touch.  
Your feedback is important to us! Please complete this survey.  
Hey, did you see the latest episode of that show? So good!  
I’ll be out of the office tomorrow but will respond to emails when I return.  
Just checking in to see if you’re feeling better.  
Thanks for your help with the project! It made a big difference.  
Your appointment is confirmed for Thursday at 3 PM.  
I have a few ideas I’d like to share with you. Can we chat?  
Looking forward to our road trip next weekend!  
Your payment of $50 has been processed successfully.  
Is there any update on the proposal we submitted?  
Can we reschedule our meeting to next week? I have a conflict.  
Hope you have a great vacation! Can’t wait to hear all about it.  
The community cleanup event is happening this Saturday at 9 AM.  
Please let me know if you need assistance with anything.  
Just wanted to remind you about the deadlines coming up this month.  
I appreciate your prompt response to my last email!  
Are you free for a quick chat tomorrow afternoon?  
Your ticket for the concert has been booked!  
Thanks for picking up the groceries for me!  
Hope you’re having a good week! Let’s catch up soon.  
The server will be down for maintenance from 12 AM to 3 AM tonight.  
I’m here if you want to talk about anything.  
Just letting you know I’ll be late to the meeting.  
Your order has shipped and is on its way!  
Congrats on finishing your project! Let’s celebrate!  
Can you remind me to call Mom later?  
Your reservation is confirmed for dinner at 7 PM.  
Thanks for the update! I’ll review the documents you sent.  
Hope the presentation went well! Let me know how it went.  
Just a quick note to say I miss you!  
Your feedback has been received. Thank you!  
Looking forward to our coffee catch-up next week!  
The team meeting has been canceled for today.  
Thanks for helping me out yesterday! I owe you one.  
Here’s the link to the article I mentioned earlier.  
Let me know if you want to join us for a movie this weekend!
